definition: to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette
band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise

sentences.english: For about a month I was listening to The Dark Knight score on repeat.
sentences.chinese: 近一個月我都在反覆聆聽《暗騎士》卡帶。

sentences.english: Take up any slack in the tape with a pencil or similar tool before use.
sentences.chinese: 用卡帶以前若有鬆弛狀態，請用鉛筆之類的工具旋緊。

sentences.english: The HOLD switch deactivates the buttons on the cassette holder.
sentences.chinese: HOLD開關可使卡帶架上的鈕鍵失效。

sentences.english: At that time, Mr Tony Wang was nicknamed "Cassette King".
sentences.chinese: 當時王振敬先生被號稱爲卡帶王。

definition: music notation in which the notes Do, Re, Mi, Fa, Sol, La and Si are represented by numerals 1 to 7
interlude/to cross the stage/to do sth as a mere formality/to go through the motions
fashionable for a while (idiom); all the rage
variant of 雙節棍|双节棍[shuang1 jie2 gun4]
